intro: [WRONG START] Narvelia pilulifera var. yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan narrow-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes. This variety is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
